views.markdown: I love you. Because you gave me light. Because you took my hand and you taught me about the world outside. Because when I trembled on lonely nights, you never stopped holding my hand. Because when I felt lonely, you kissed me and said that I wasn't alone. You gave me so many things. That's why I love you. Because you gave me everything.

• The official Swift successor to Satella
  • Compatible with iOS 12-16 and all devices
  • Fast and lightweight
  • Receipt generator and custom observer to increase success rate
  • Choose which apps to inject Satella into
  • Purchases have persistence and can even be restored on a non-jailbroken device using app data backups in iMazing, 3uTools, or i4Tools
  • Experimental support for in-app purchases in sideloaded apps
  • Experimental stealth toggle to hide from piracy detection

• Enable Disabling this prevents Satella from working, obviously
  • Receipts Create a false receipt and hijack Apple's default verification. Most effective on iOS 12-13, but occasionally works on iOS 14-16
  • Observer Prevent duplicate purchases taking the same memory (fixes some apps)
  • Sideloaded Apps Add compatibility for sideloaded apps that are not permasigned. Disable this if you are having trouble with App Store apps.
  • Stealth Attempt to hide Satella from common methods of piracy detection
  • 0,00 Price Change the price label to 0,01 (debug purposes)
    • Global Injection Enable Satella in all user apps by default
  • Enabled Apps Enable Satella in specific apps of your choice. Overridden by Global Injection, if it is enabled.

• Not every app is compatible. That would be impossible. If it doesn't work with LocalIAPStore or Satella either, give up.
  • Additionally, Satella is a generic IAP cracker, not a specific one. Please don't make a GitHub issue or ping me asking me to make it work with X app.

• Updated Jinx version, which should fix a rare crash in the Stealth toggle
